html: I'm donating my salary from the government shutdown to YouthWorks in ND. It's a critical organization doing important work to combat youth homelessness and help stop human trafficking.

html: It's unfortunate for families & workers that the federal gov't shut down again - the 3rd time in the past 2 yrs. As I've done before, I'll donate my salary from the shutdown. It's the right thing to do when so many are feeling the impacts of this poor move by the administration.

html: For two years, I've been asking for the administration's plan for border security at the Southern Border. Crickets. No corporate board room would give a CEO money for a project without a plan.

html: Just landed back in DC to vote no on the CR. The Senate already passed a bipartisan bill to fund the government. Now the House needs to pass it and the President should sign it.

html: And the #FarmBill - which looks very similar to the bipartisan Senate bill I helped write, negotiate, and pass - was just signed into law. This is what working and getting results up until the very end looks like.

text:
On Savanna's Act - @SenatorHeitkamp tells Congress: 
Get to work. 'You're getting a paycheck!'

#SavannasAct increases access to crime database info for #MMIW. 
It's being stalled with a few days left to vote in House session.

html: Why we need #SavannasAct: In 2016, there were 5,712 incidents of missing & murdered Native American women. By passing my bill, we can work to address this epidemic of violence & help law enforcement crack down on these horrible crimes.pic.twitter.com/ckn04cwXEF

html: 84% of Native American women experience violence in their lifetime, but few outside of Indian Country are aware of this epidemic. I intro'd #SavannasAct—named after Savanna Greywind of Fargo ND who was murdered last year—to help law enforcement crack down on these horrible crimes

html: I often shared the Native American principle called 7 generations with folks in my office, which urges decision making in a way that looks at how this generation’s decisions will affect the next 7 generations, which helps guide our work toward a much broader purpose.pic.twitter.com/V4AoIH1Tf5

html: Against all odds, with a prediction of only 8%, I joined the U.S. Senate. Growing up, my family struggled to get by & it’s a great American story that somebody from my background could actually become a U.S. senator.pic.twitter.com/3ZLdsqq92J
text: Against all odds, with a prediction of only 8%, I joined the U.S. Senate. Growing up, my family struggled to get by & it’s a great American story that somebody from my background could actually become a U.S. senator.pic.twitter.com/3ZLdsqq92J

html: In 2000 I was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. My oncologists told me I had a 28% chance of living more than 10 years. I knew right away that I had a chance to use what time God gave me for good & noble purposes. I chose to come to the U.S. Senate.pic.twitter.com/hdRyPHFuAV
text: In 2000 I was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. My oncologists told me I had a 28% chance of living more than 10 years. I knew right away that I had a chance to use what time God gave me for good & noble purposes. I chose to come to the U.S. Senate.pic.twitter.com/hdRyPHFuAV

html: Too many lives & families across rural America have been ripped apart by opioid addiction & abuse. Since joining the US Senate, I’ve been working to bring all sides together to deliver the support our communities desperately need. Read more on @Medium:https://medium.com/@SenatorHeitkamp/opioid-abuse-is-ripping-apart-north-dakotas-communities-and-it-s-past-time-to-take-action-d96d1137a783 …
text: Too many lives & families across rural America have been ripped apart by opioid addiction & abuse. html: A key health care provision that is law enables young adults to stay on their parents’ health insurance until they are 26 years old. We need to keep this protection in place to enable young adults who are transitioning into the workforce to have access to affordable health care.
text: A key health care provision that is law enables young adults to stay on their parents’ health insurance until they are 26 years old. We need to keep this protection in place to enable young adults who are transitioning into the workforce to have access to affordable health care.

html: 70% of North Dakota soybeans are typically exported to Asia, primarily China. But China is moving to cut U.S. soybeans out of their market entirely, putting North Dakota’s crop – valued at $2.1 billion last year – in peril.https://www.cnn.com/2018/10/24/economy/china-soybeans-trade-war/index.html …

html: After hearing abt severe mail delivery issues in South Fargo in 2016, I worked to fix the problem by pressing USPS about it. html: From day one, I’ve been pushing for smart trade policies that hold China accountable while preserving markets for ND goods. That’s the responsible approach the administration should take to protect our farmers, workers, & rural economy.
text: From day one, I’ve been pushing for smart trade policies that hold China accountable while preserving markets for ND goods. That’s the responsible approach the administration should take to protect our farmers, workers, & rural economy.

html: Farmers know their business & the importance of exports better than anyone in Washington. The administration should listen to them & end this damaging trade war.
text: Farmers know their business & the importance of exports better than anyone in Washington. The administration should listen to them & end this damaging trade war.

html: The pace of soybean exports to China has dipped 96% this marketing year amid the administration’s #tradewar. This is devastating for ND soybean farmers—and exactly what they’ve been warning against.pic.twitter.com/1rM76wxP1J

html: The #RuralMOMSAct builds on my bipartisan bill to boost our research efforts to understand why we’re seeing rising maternal deaths in a nation as advanced as the United States so we can build stronger, safer, & healthier rural & tribal communities.
text: The #RuralMOMSAct builds on my bipartisan bill to boost our research efforts to understand why we’re seeing rising maternal deaths in a nation as advanced as the United States so we can build stronger, safer, & healthier rural & tribal communities.

html: In September I met w/ mothers in Grand Forks who experienced complications during their pregnancies, during childbirth or during post-partum periods—their stories were harrowing & no mother should experience the physical & emotional distress of preventable pregnancy complicationspic.twitter.com/oTrVZxrm73
text: In September I met w/ mothers in Grand Forks who experienced complications during their pregnancies, during childbirth or during post-partum periods—their stories were harrowing & no mother should experience the physical & emotional distress of preventable pregnancy complicationspic.twitter.com/oTrVZxrm73

html: Sadly, more women in the United States die from pregnancy-related complications than in most other developed nations & the @CDC reports that pregnancy-related deaths in the US increased by 250% from 1987-2014. #RuralMOMSAct
text: Sadly, more women in the United States die from pregnancy-related complications than in most other developed nations & the @CDC reports that pregnancy-related deaths in the US increased by 250% from 1987-2014. #RuralMOMSAct

html: To help combat the growing maternal mortality crisis in rural America & Indian Country I intro’d the #RuralMOMSAct to prioritize collecting rural maternal health data, expand info-sharing between rural obstetricians & increase access to training for nurses, midwives & physicians.pic.twitter.com/yRzjqiiI8s
text: To help combat the growing maternal mortality crisis in rural America & Indian Country I intro’d the #RuralMOMSAct to prioritize collecting rural maternal health data, expand info-sharing between rural obstetricians & increase access to training for nurses, midwives & physicians.pic.twitter.com/yRzjqiiI8s

html: Every day, I come to work in the U.S. Senate fighting for North Dakota. My parents taught me that we could disagree, but at the end of the day, we always worked to together to put the Christmas lights up. Those are the values that I’ve brought to the Senate.pic.twitter.com/uRmphLetua

html: Language barriers, prohibitive ID requirements, unreliable rural mail delivery & other issues create barriers to voting for Native Americans in rural areas. I spoke in a US Senate committee earlier this year on how to address so voting is accessible, simple, & fair for everyone.pic.twitter.com/rPAJ4EpHnA
text:
Language barriers, prohibitive ID requirements, unreliable rural mail delivery & other issues create barriers to voting for Native Americans in
 rural areas. I spoke in a US Senate committee earlier this year on how to address so voting is accessible, simple, & fair for everyone.pic.twitter.com/rPAJ4EpHnA

html: Our country’s #NorthernBorder is the world’s longest common-law border, has 120 border crossings, many of which are small and in rural areas. Approx. 400,000 people and over $1.6 billion in goods and services cross the Northern Border each day.

html: Our bill is especially needed to prevent Native American voters from being disenfranchised after #SCOTUS declined to hear an emergency appeal based on the confusion created by reverting back to ND’s burdensome voter ID law that makes it harder for Native Americans in ND to vote.
text: Our bill is especially needed to prevent Native American voters from being disenfranchised after #SCOTUS declined to hear an emergency appeal based on the confusion created by reverting back to ND’s burdensome voter ID law that makes it harder for Native Americans in ND to vote.

html: Native Americans served in the military before they were even allowed to vote & continue to serve at the highest rate of any population in this country. We need to put an end to every form of voter discrimination, & our bill would be an important starting point.
text: Native Americans served in the military before they were even allowed to vote & continue to serve at the highest rate of any population in this country. We need to put an end to every form of voter discrimination, & our bill would be an important starting point.

html: Voting should be accessible, simple & fair for everyone—but Native American communities face unique challenges in our electoral process. html: From the beginning of the renegotiation of #NAFTA—which has been going on for over a year—I’ve been pushing for a deal that maintains ND’s critical trade relationships w/ Canada & Mexico & addresses several issues important to North Dakota agriculture
text: From the beginning of the renegotiation of #NAFTA—which has been going on for over a year—I’ve been pushing for a deal that maintains ND’s critical trade relationships w/ Canada & Mexico & addresses several issues important to North Dakota agriculture

html: The administration’s new #trade agreement w/ Canada & Mexico is good news for wheat growers who would no longer face an unfair Canadian grading system—a change I’ve been pushing for—but it’s disappointing the concerns of cattle ranchers & potato farmers were not addressed.pic.twitter.com/1DIW3m0mvr
text: The administration’s new #trade agreement w/ Canada & Mexico is good news for wheat growers who would no longer face an unfair Canadian grading system—a change I’ve been pushing for—but it’s disappointing the concerns of cattle ranchers & potato farmers were not addressed.pic.twitter.com/1DIW3m0mvr

html: It’s great news for ND to finally see the issue resolved in a way that will make brick—&—mortar biz more competitive & boost state revenue, adding needed resources that can support investments in education, infrastructure & other state projects— which benefits every community.
text: It’s great news for ND to finally see the issue resolved in a way that will make brick—&—mortar biz more competitive & boost state revenue, adding needed resources that can support investments in education, infrastructure & other state projects— which benefits every community.

html: ND estimates that it could collect $50 million in additional revenue annually. In 2015 alone, the total uncollected sales & use taxes in the US was nearly $26 billion. Retailers w/o a physical presence have a price advantage over brick-&-mortar businesses of up to 8.5% in ND.
text: ND estimates that it could collect $50 million in additional revenue annually. In 2015 alone, the total uncollected sales & use taxes in the US was nearly $26 billion. Retailers w/o a physical presence have a price advantage over brick-&-mortar businesses of up to 8.5% in ND.

html: As ND’s Tax Commissioner in 1992, I brought #NDvQuill to #SCOTUS in an effort to require catalog retailers to collect state sales & use taxes—the Court didn’t decide favorably then, but I pushed to take up a new case to resolve the issue—& it did w/ its #SDvWayfair ruling in Junepic.twitter.com/tUiOJAPzZw
text: As ND’s Tax Commissioner in 1992, I brought #NDvQuill to #SCOTUS in an effort to require catalog retailers to collect state sales & use taxes—the Court didn’t decide favorably then, but I pushed to take up a new case to resolve the issue—& it did w/ its #SDvWayfair ruling in Junepic.twitter.com/tUiOJAPzZw

html: Today, ND will begin collecting sales & use tax from online & out-of-state vendors, a huge victory for the state & #smallbiz that have been at a competitive disadvantage—the result of my decades-long effort to level the playing field for brick-&-mortar biz in North Dakota.pic.twitter.com/l0qUTePjg4
text: Today, ND will begin collecting sales & use tax from online & out-of-state vendors, a huge victory for the state & #smallbiz that have been at a competitive disadvantage—the result of my decades-long effort to level the playing field for brick-&-mortar biz in North Dakota.pic.twitter.com/l0qUTePjg4

html: I’ll continue to work toward passing a final #FarmBill as soon as possible, and House Republicans should join the Senate to put politics aside and get back to work on behalf of farm country.
text: I’ll continue to work toward passing a final #FarmBill as soon as possible, and House Republicans should join the Senate to put politics aside and get back to work on behalf of farm country.

html: The US Senate passed a strong #FarmBill w/ historic support from Rs & Ds—we need House Republicans to commit to coming to the table to compromise so Congress can do its job to support farmers & ranchers.
text: The US Senate passed a strong #FarmBill w/ historic support from Rs & Ds—we need House Republicans to commit to coming to the table to compromise so Congress can do its job to support farmers & ranchers.

html: Disappointing that at a time of turmoil in farm country due to the administration's #tradewar, the US House of Representatives took a break in August & much of September— and has now adjourned until mid-November.
text: Disappointing that at a time of turmoil in farm country due to the administration's #tradewar, the US House of Representatives took a break in August & much of September— and has now adjourned until mid-November.

html: The current #FarmBill expires at midnight tonight. Americans expect members of Congress to get to work and do their jobs, but passing a strong Farm Bill is clearly not the priority it should be for House Republicans who want to keep pushing partisan provisions.
text: The current #FarmBill expires at midnight tonight. Americans expect members of Congress to get to work and do their jobs, but passing a strong Farm Bill is clearly not the priority it should be for House Republicans who want to keep pushing partisan provisions.

html: Women face poverty in retirement at rates drastically higher than men. No one should have to worry about losing retirement savings or falling into poverty in their golden years—our bill would help more ND women enjoy the long-term retirement security they’ve earned.
text: Women face poverty in retirement at rates drastically higher than men. No one should have to worry about losing retirement savings or falling into poverty in their golden years—our bill would help more ND women enjoy the long-term retirement security they’ve earned.

html: In 2014, median retirement income for women was just 55% of the avg male retirement income. Also, women 65+ are 80% more likely to fall into poverty during retirement & are more likely to leave the workforce during their income-earning years to become caregivers for loved ones.
text: In 2014, median retirement income for women was just 55% of the avg male retirement income. Also, women 65+ are 80% more likely to fall into poverty during retirement & are more likely to leave the workforce during their income-earning years to become caregivers for loved ones.

html: Too often, women face challenges in the workplace w/ gender pay disparities & lack of access to paid leave to care for family members or newborns. html: I’ll keep pushing for solutions & action to end to this trade war and for smart trade policies that hold China accountable while also protecting markets for North Dakota goods.
text: I’ll keep pushing for solutions & action to end to this trade war and for smart trade policies that hold China accountable while also protecting markets for North Dakota goods.

html: North Dakota commodities affected by this round of retaliatory tariffs from China include: Beef—ND ranchers held nearly 1 million beef cattle at the start of 2018 Wheat—$2.76 billion in 2017 Dry Edible Beans—$301 million in 2017 Peas & Lentils—$151.3 million in 2017
text:
North Dakota commodities affected by this round of retaliatory tariffs from China include:
 Beef—ND ranchers held nearly 1 million beef cattle at the start of 2018
 Wheat—$2.76 billion in 2017
 Dry Edible Beans—$301 million in 2017
 Peas & Lentils—$151.3 million in 2017

html: The trade war is already hurting farmers & ranchers by causing commodity prices to fall & orders to be cancelled. Not a single order for North Dakota soybeans has been placed by China, which was the biggest customer of the our state’s crop—a value of $2.13 billion in 2017.
text: The trade war is already hurting farmers & ranchers by causing commodity prices to fall & orders to be cancelled. Not a single order for North Dakota soybeans has been placed by China, which was the biggest customer of the our state’s crop—a value of $2.13 billion in 2017.

html: Earlier this week, I also helped pass a bipartisan funding bill that includes wins I secured: $50m in funding for a new initiative aimed at reducing maternal mortality. The bill also includes $12 million for expanded data collection at State Maternal Mortality review boards.
text: Earlier this week, I also helped pass a bipartisan funding bill that includes wins I secured: $50m in funding for a new initiative aimed at reducing maternal mortality. The bill also includes $12 million for expanded data collection at State Maternal Mortality review boards.

html: My bipartisan bill would help facilitate stronger, safer, & healthier pregnancies by investing in cutting-edge research, beefing up information sharing, & giving physicians & providers the tools they need to improve the patient experience.
text: My bipartisan bill would help facilitate stronger, safer, & healthier pregnancies by investing in cutting-edge research, beefing up information sharing, & giving physicians & providers the tools they need to improve the patient experience.

html: According to @CDCgov, pregnancy-related deaths in the US rose by 250% from 1987-2014. We need to figure out what’s going on, & that requires collecting data to identify the factors that are causing young mothers to experience life-threatening health issues.

html: The 1st bill I introduced in the US Senate became law & created a Commission on Native Children. Now that it’s up & running, it can work to improve graduation rates, build better career paths & treat effects of childhood trauma. html: Over the last few years, Russian foreign policy has aggressively violated the sovereignty of US elections & the privacy of US companies & citizens. We need to increase our resolve to deter these activities while preventing future cyberattacks on our elections & businesses.

html: Last month, I cosponsored a bill with @SenJohnBarrasso to suspend the Health Insurance Tax through 2020 that could impact nearly 71,000 #smallbiz & 200,000 workers who would see premiums increase. Successfully suspended this tax through 2019, now need to go further.pic.twitter.com/K7SMuEwFMo
text: Last month, I cosponsored a bill with @SenJohnBarrasso to suspend the Health Insurance Tax through 2020 that could impact nearly 71,000 #smallbiz & 200,000 workers who would see premiums increase. Successfully suspended this tax through 2019, now need to go further.pic.twitter.com/K7SMuEwFMo

html: In January, I successfully delayed the health reform law’s Health Insurance Tax thru 2019. A new @OliverWyman report shows how this tax would result in higher health insurance premiums totaling over $48 million for NDans in 2020—unless Congress took action http://health.oliverwyman.com/transform-care/2018/08/new_analysis_howth.html …

html: North Dakota suffers from the 5th-worst pay gap in the U.S. & it’s even worse for Native American women who make, on average, 62 cents for every dollar a man makes. Let #WomensEqualityDay be a reminder of the importance of ensuring mothers & women everywhere have #EqualPay.
text: North Dakota suffers from the 5th-worst pay gap in the U.S. & it’s even worse for Native American women who make, on average, 62 cents for every dollar a man makes. Let #WomensEqualityDay be a reminder of the importance of ensuring mothers & women everywhere have #EqualPay.

html: Today is #WomensEqualityDay, a day to remember when the 19th amendment giving women the right to vote was certified in 1920. So many strong women before us fought for that right, & since that day, we have made so much more progress for women. But there is still much work to do.pic.twitter.com/3ryMXZGNht
